title: Smith space
summary: In functional analysis and related areas of mathematics, a Smith space is a complete compactly generated locally convex topological vector space X {\displaystyle X} having a universal compact set, i.e. a compact set K {\displaystyle K} which absorbs every other compact set T ⊆ X {\displaystyle T\subseteq X} (i.e. T ⊆ λ ⋅ K {\displaystyle T\subseteq \lambda \cdot K} for some λ > 0 {\displaystyle \lambda >0} ).
